application

Class DistributionManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • application.DistributionManager

  • public class DistributionManager
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is intended to manage Distribution Centers and is accessed by Administrator and Inventory
    Author:
    group_0549

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      DistributionManager(Inventory inventory)
      This method initializes a DistributionManager

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addDistributionCenerFile(DistributionCenter DC)
      Adds a distribution center to the Distribution Centers file
      void addDistributionCenter(DistributionCenter dc, java.lang.String name)
      This method adds a Distribution Center to the list of Distribution Centers
      void addProductToFile(Product product)
      Adds the product specified to the list and sets the quantity to 0 If the given distribution center exists, or sesionID invalid, do nothing.
      void changeProductQuantity(Product product, int quantity, DistributionCenter DC)
      Changes the quantity of the product in particular Distribution Center
      java.util.ArrayList<DistributionCenter> getDistributionCentres()
      This method returns all the Distribution Centers in a list
      void loadFile()
      This method loads the file, by creating a new Distribution Center and then finding the products in the product list by their descriptions and then adding the product and it's quantity to the HashMap in each Distribution Center

      This method sets the list of Distributions Centers to the one specified

    • Method Detail

      • getDistributionCentres

        public java.util.ArrayList<DistributionCenter> getDistributionCentres()
        This method returns all the Distribution Centers in a list
        Returns:
        -> ArrayList of all Distribution Centers

      • setDistributionCentres

        public void setDistributionCentres(java.util.ArrayList<DistributionCenter> distributionCentres)
        This method sets the list of Distributions Centers to the one specified
        Parameters:
        distributionCentres - -> ArrayList of all Distribution Centers

      • addDistributionCenter

        public void addDistributionCenter(DistributionCenter dc,
                                  java.lang.String name)
        This method adds a Distribution Center to the list of Distribution Centers
        Parameters:
        dc - -> the name of the Distribution Center to be added

      • loadFile

        public void loadFile()
        This method loads the file, by creating a new Distribution Center and then finding the products in the product list by their descriptions and then adding the product and it's quantity to the HashMap in each Distribution Center

      • changeProductQuantity

        public void changeProductQuantity(Product product,
                                  int quantity,
                                  DistributionCenter DC)
        Changes the quantity of the product in particular Distribution Center
        Parameters:
        product - -> The product's quantity to be updated
        quantity - -> Quantity to set instead of existing quantity
        DC - -> Distribution Center (in effect a city name) If currently the product with ID 112 has quantity 100 in Toronto, after the statement changeProductQuantity(product, "Toronto", 51) same product must have quantity 51 in the Toronto distribution center.

      • addDistributionCenerFile

        public void addDistributionCenerFile(DistributionCenter DC)
        Adds a distribution center to the Distribution Centers file
        Parameters:
        DC - -> The Distribution Center with a variable city.

      • addProductToFile

        public void addProductToFile(Product product)
        Adds the product specified to the list and sets the quantity to 0 If the given distribution center exists, or sesionID invalid, do nothing.
        Parameters:
        city - -> The city where distribution center must be based.
        sessionID - -> A session ID that belongs to an authenticated administrator
